document.docAuthor: Ranjith, A. P., Samartsev, K. G. & Nasser, M.
document.masterDocTitle: Discovery of the braconid subfamily Dirrhopinae van Achterberg (Hymenoptera Ichneumonoidea) from the Indian subcontinent with the description of a new species from south India

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Discovery of the braconid subfamily Dirrhopinae van Achterberg (Hymenoptera Ichneumonoidea) from the Indian subcontinent with the description of a new species from south India

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Dirrhope Foerster, 1851: 39
;
Belokobylskij, 1998: 547
. Type species:
Dirrhope rufa Foerster.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis : Head and mesosoma rather robust ( Figs 1A & E , 3A , 4A , 5A & F , 7A & E ), granulate ( Fig. 1B ) or densely reticulate-rugose ( Figs 3B , 5B , 7B ), metasoma comparatively weak ( Figs 1A , 3A , 4A , 5A , 7A ); head transverse ( Figs 1B , 3B , 5B , 7B ); occipital carina rather absent ( Figs 1C , 7C ) or incomplete ( Figs 6A , 8A & B ); eye glabrous ( Figs 1B, C & E , 3B & F , 5B & C , 7 B–E); frons concave laterally, distinctly protruding medially, with one longitudinal ridge-like carina extending to area between antennal sockets ( Figs 3F , 5C ), sometimes to middle of face ( Fig. 1C ); ocelli arranged in an equilateral triangle; antenna 18–24 antennomeres, first flagellomere slightly longer than second; anterior tentorial pits relatively large ( Figs 1B , 3B , 5B , 7B ); clypeus convex, protruding in lateral view ( Figs 1E , 3D , 4A , 6A , 7E ); clypeal suture deep ( Figs 1B , 3B , 5B , 7B ); malar suture present ( Figs 1B , 3B , 5B & D , 7B & E ); maxillary palp with 6 palpomeres, third palpomere distinctly swollen ( Fig. 5D ); labial palp with 4 palpomeres ( Fig. 5D ); propleural lobe present ( Figs 1E , 3D , 5F , 7E ); notauli usually incomplete, distinct basally ( Figs 1D , 3C & F , 5E , 7D ); prepectal carina present ( Figs 1E , 5F , 7E ); precoxal sulcus present but shallow ( Figs 1E , 4A , 5F , 7E ); propodeum distinctly areolate and carinate ( Figs 1F , 4C , 6B , 7F ); fore wing vein 1-R1 present ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); vein r-m of fore wing absent ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); vein 2-1A largely obsolescent ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); second submarginal and subdiscal cells open ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); veins 1-M and 1-SR+M arising from parastigma ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); vein m-cu antefurcal ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); vein cu-a distinctly postfurcal ( Figs 2C , 4D , 6C , 8B ); first tergite relatively slender, parallel-sided, spiracles situated behind middle of first tergite on its dorsal side ( Figs 2A , 5E , 7F ).
